page.title: 16ECOLOGY, FAUNA, ASHBY MAGNA
page.content: Three species of tit are common with blue, great and long tailed both summer and winter. Finches also flock in the winter and yellow hammers are common. Blackbirds and thrush are seen year round and fieldfare and redwing appear early in autumn and are found in gardens in hard winters. Green and lesser spotted woodpeckers are frequently seen and large numbers of magpies reflect easy pickings in spring and summer. 3 species of owl are found with little owl commonly seen, and tawny and barn owl. The most potentially interesting area is that of the disused airfield. The centre of the airfield is rough and undisturbed and moorland bird species such as curlews are resting there. Development as a nature reserve is now being sought and should provide interest in the future.
